ywzThWVBEpDWGZFvyPC7tg.text: Quite possibly the slowest restaurant in Matthews. Waited half an hour for my Goat Haleem. To make things even worse, the Goat Haleem sounds great on paper, what the menu description conveniently leaves out is that all ingredients are pureed together. It's like a tiny bowl of mushy meat and vegetables cereal! And way too expensive for the portion size.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. The Goat Haleem

FY7bG3zeKo5XRszVsIZPhw.text: Great Food!!!! The first restaurant in Charlotte where I actually enjoyed the Kabobs. We ordered boti, chicken and beef kabobs and they were really good. The green chutney that came with the food was really good as well and we had to bring some with us for the left overs. The owner came out to greet us and asked for feedback which was nice since they want to improve. I would definitely visit this place again.

bg84HFhmSkcGIkoDIRKH_g.text: I couldn't think of one reason to give this place a 4!  Great price for portion and the most authentic and tasty Indian food I've had in Charlotte. Small place but clean and welcoming decor. Owners quite friendly. Hope this one stays around.

s1EunryYYHa5BsmZ60ywwA.text: Really enjoyed both curries I got. The highlight though was khatmandu chicken! Finished up with masala chai which was delicious.

domWVQcKYYS1nwl0VUn2-A.text: This is authentic hyderabadi cuisine. I had the Nihari which was delightfully aromatic and tender and the kabobs were succulent. I'm tired of dried out over cooked kabobs so really great that they got it right.   I've eaten at most of the local Indian places but this is really outstanding. Also found staff to be friendly and responsive.  Nice that it's right next to the movie theater.   This is my new fav for kabobs in Charlotte.   (Qualification: I am from India and am a kabob connoisseur hehe )

0DXuU_qV5vdoNyxFO2gDtg.text: Good food, ordered goat briyani and chicken kabab, rice was kabab was good too.. gave suggestion to keep momos

xLqMSuoHevJWMkd6JTIk2w.text: Highest recommendation, unusual and outstanding food quality and is prepared perfectly. Its a perfect hyderabadi style biryani. Loved the platters.

VoFx5Fjgs8IGmCuc7iJubg.text: On my first visit I called my order in and still had a 25 min wait once I arrived. I only stuck around because I was set on Indian food. Glad I waited because the mixed veggies and naan were great. 2nd visit, called it in and still had a 15 min wait. I ordered the same dish and it was nothing like what I had the first time. For the mixed veggies they used totally different vegetables which included broccoli and cauliflower, not good because they cooked it too long and the veggies turned mushy and the dish was much smaller. I won't be going back.

JyNfZfyBbxqz43lCg9Be9Q.text: I did not finish this meal. It was too good! I saved some to take home. I had the Kadhai Chicken with Garlic Naan and rice and savored every bite.  It's been difficult to find excellent dining experiences since moving to this side of town but Royal Biryani & Kabob is really good, and it's very affordably priced, too.  They have been open a month and it shows. It is almost a model in disorganization and confusion but the staff and owner are helpful friendly and accommodating as they get their sea legs in this endeavor.  The food is excellent enough to make up for any startup inconveniences!

Wt-a6amYTKgbYZBWHTeL_Q.text: The food and customer service were amazing! It was my first time trying Indian cuisine and I loved it.  I have been twice and will continue to go.

zsP0Ayrk2Xm_oud-nYD4-Q.text: The restaurant has great food. My favorite was the kadhai goat. I would definitely recommend this place to others.

Co2SaGOlr6tKtem5MsGPWA.text: While the food on the other tables looked good, my experience was different. 45 minutes in an empty restaurant to get a lamb kabab. While the meat was well seasoned, it was very over cooked and required a dipping sauce (ordered extra) to get it down. The naan, when it eventually arrived half way through the meal, was tasty.   If it wasn't for the poor service, slow delivery, modest portions, bad cooking and over inflated prices, it could be a nice place. I hope I just had a rare bad experience. But from now on I'll just to back to Pita Kabab Grill.

IQS9nWYzrWnDLOIDugDUtA.text: This place is arguably THE most authentic Indian restaurant in town. We went to Royal Biryani and Kabob this past Saturday and here are our thoughts:  The Good: - The Food:  is arguably the best Indian food we have had in Charlotte. We have tried The Taj, Copper amongst other Indian restaurants but if you go by the sheer authenticity and quality of of the food, Royal Biryani and Kabob wins, hands down. To our knowledge, there isn't any other place that offers more authentic Indian cuisine in town.  The Bad: - Service : We dined in with 2 kids and 2 adults. They do not exactly have dedicated serving staff. They had 2 folks handling the takeout and dine-in business at the same time. Our food also took forever to arrive, it almost seemed like they were giving priority to their takeout orders.  - Space: Do not come here for the ambience, there is none. The space is spartan and the service, like mentioned above fairly non existent. The advice to the owner is that perhaps they should invest in dedicated wait staff.   I hope the owner can improve the dine-in experience, because the food is simply amazing.

RhUmCKFJ0DY9P1NrxWPtSQ.text: The food was amazingly good!! We had lamb seehk kabobs, kadhai goat and tandoori chicken and all three were made fresh to order.  The people were very nice and attentive.  We will be back for lunch today!

GRkE2TqqFNRYbZuowreu1g.text: Great food that comes with superb service. The food was awesome everything we ordered was freshly prepared. The owners are really nice people and are doing a great job. The food tends to take a while as everything is freshly prepared. Will definitely be going back.

6YHW4vddDMhAdxVPZu4M2g.text: Very bad experience. Food quality was not up to mark as mentioned in the above reviews.

DVnDQOojcI4QU4_ZANMX0w.text: If you are thinking about going here, think twice. Food was barely acceptable; the entrees (4people eating) did not come out together, some food was cool. The service was poor; wait time for our order was 40 minuets. We were the only customers at 6:30, so service should have been much better. We will not be going back.

NwPxTJHBq1qdA5XCIEFHXg.text: My husband and I dined here last night first impression was it is a takeout joint with places to sit and eat if you wish to. We decided to eat in the waiter came and took our order and offered us a pitcher of water. I ordered the butter chicken which was fabulous and very tasty and my husband ordered the chicken Haleem which he said was delicious. Only problem was we didn't get any rice and these are gravy dishes and are in dire need of rice so I asked the waiter for some and he looked at me a little odd and said OK but the rice never came so I asked a different person for rice and eventually rice did show up. I checked the menu and it appears that rice is separate for a charge of $4.99 which in my mind is ridiculous. A fellow I believe is the owner came over to us and said they made a change in that rice  is now not extra but you still have to order it. We also ordered the garlic naan which was very good and had an appetizer of the vegetable Samosa which was good if not a little dry and spicy. I ordered a cup of chai tea which took a while to get that was very good. All in all I would say the food here is excellent but they are disorganized which I am sure they will work out with time as they said they had only been open for 30 days. On a sidenote I just ate my leftovers for lunch and they were just as good as it was last night. We highly recommend this restaurant for very good authentic Indian food.

aojvWUaLCDUE4V7396rYDw.text: Great food, clean place and very friendly! Even though they were very busy they made up for it by keeping us updated and bringing out fresh good food. Highly recommend!! Chicken tikka boti especially was superb - soft and juicy to the mark.

LRCzkF_Bqpu8OhRRjmHcIA.text: Exceptional... hyderabad style.. food. Believe me all food lovers if you are in to and looking for some delicious hyderabad biryani, kebobs and naans..then you got to come and visit this place. Every resturant says that we serve hyderabad dum biryani.. but as soon as you eat you would say.. f**ck this right. Unlike them these guys really serve very good hyderabad biryani..

4tYuGRaQW_xHsq-wZgPb6w.text: The food is great but the wait time for the food even on a pick up order is unacceptable. The restaurant has great potential but as of right now I would have to say it's not there yet. I placed and order and had to wait an hour for it to be cooked.  I went to pick up the food after 45 minutes of waiting and the food was still not ready the man upfront told me it would be another 20 minutes of waiting. I decided to just cancel the order and took my money elsewhere. This behavior is beyond customer abuse. No sense of urgency and a total waste of customers time.

Astngcf1CbZ8aDNWQpgiFA.text: Food is very good, if a bit expensive. Not many Indian options in Matthews so I was excited for something so close. Says they do dine in, but they're definitely not setup for it.  I received my food, then our appetizer came 5 minutes later, followed shortly by my wife's haleem and probably 10 minutes later my son's biriyani came out.    No glasses, water is bottled and $1.20, which costs more than their canned soda offering. A pitcher of tap water would be fine, but wasn't offered. Something to keep in mind if you order something spicy... Mango lassy came in small styrofoam cup.   Would probably order again for takeout, but the meals seemed lacking. Order a kebab and that's all you get, $10 for a couple chunks of meat. $14 haleem, same deal. No bread, no rice, no veg, everything is ordered separately. Kinda hard to make a meal without spending $20/pp ordering multiple things and $50-60 is a lot to spend on takeout.

YFYNswcF1uvDG45iyu3nfQ.text: I've been to many authentic food stops and this one is just unbelievably good. This is the best place to get great Indian food at affordable prices! The selection of curry that you can get is extensive and holds a lot of variety. From spicy and runny to thick and creamy, their curry is to die for. The samosa is really good and flaky. Staff is very friendly and helpful. This place deserves more business because it's the best Indian food around.

b5N4xG-fAUrGVGYSxgwiyQ.text: Are they permanently closed ? Website keeps saying closed for renovations  Hope to hear from the management . Happy holidays

LuR14j_Br9msUOV1lhNClQ.text: Absolutely phenomenal food and service! Very authentic, well crafted food. We absolutely enjoyed our experience here and can't wait to go back! big portions, you can choose your own spice level. Highly recommended.

f1f-kfAsyAoBxeyoXiOeQw.text: First time trying Indian food and was amazed. The food is great and the service was awesome.  The spice level goes to 10 but I can't handle too much so I went with a 4 and it was perfect. I will definitely be back!

9n1K9brzPVNcRZPhZqAOdg.text: Absolutely AMAZING!! This is by and far the best Indian food we've ever eaten. The food and service are outstanding. If you're looking for a fabulous meal that will entice even the most discerning foodie, this is the place to go!  We've gone there several times and tried almost everything on the menu. There's nothing that isn't absolutely delicious. You can't go wrong!

cEMKBc_AJCvCozxzccR1iA.text: Be careful when you ask for spicy food. They actually put red chillies in your curries and it just makes it difficult to eat while chewing on chillies in every bite. I wish they would instead make changes in their original method while fulfilling the hotness demands. The chicken curries were tasty but paneer tikka masala wasn't so great.

unxU95pdzOBP6jlc_9Gu0w.text: I popped in about a month ago. I am a big fan of Indian food and was anxious to try this place out. They are conveniently located near me and I'm very excited about that. I wish I could recall what I had. It was truly wonderful. The waitress was very helpful in helping me pick something out. I told her I was a vegetarian and she made several suggestions. It was very good and there was more than enough for leftovers. I have a feeling I will be stopping in quite frequently.

3N56AbyXtTJfZpDmavAhtg.text: Amazing food. Love it. I go to this place every chance I get. Their Kathmandu chicken is amazing.

sbajLj8MxyS-OWPFFZ1Yqg.text: Stopped by today to get something to go for lunch. Ordered a staple, chicken tikka masala, and was underwhelmed. The sauce was bland and the chicken wasn't tender. To top it off, there is no lunch menu, so you'll be paying dinner (expensive) prices for a lunch-sized portion. No other items are included with the meal (except for rice). I was expecting at least one piece of naan. I eat at other Indian restaurants where lunch portions are adequate, well-flavored and include sides and naan for less than what I paid. Disappointed this wasn't a better experience since I live near this location and was hoping to visit regularly.

eWX1PHymr1oLEAuEDF9oUA.text: Went for lunch and was truly amazed how good it was! I will return! Everyone I was with loved what they had and were equally impressed!

BkULjVrTZsUxvopIu_S9Rw.text: With our kitchen being out, I have the chance to visit places that we normally do not visit.  Royal Biryani was quite pleasant, we ordered take out and the dishes were explained to me by my boss from northern India.  His descriptions we dead on for what I was expecting and made me think that this is quite traditional.  Very delicious, I want to get what ever that thin rice is for home!  I reheated a paneer kabob the next day and was again so pleased and I will get some extra 'white' sauce (forgot the name) next time.  I thought it was funny in talking to my boss, when we got to the desserts, he thought the fired banana was not traditional.  Thanks for a great meal+ Will be back.

9wFkXKIFdr_EpLiDA66aUQ.text: My rating is zero.. please refer to my last rating and comments for the same restaurant and it was a 5*..Got to know that they have changed the chef and the new chef compromised quality over time.. the biriyani came quick but it was all shit..if Najma( pervious chef's name ) prepares the biriyani do come for sure but if it is the new chef, do keep safe distance.. the meat was smelly as well.. so if u care for your health just run away from this restaurant..one last thing- Najma will cook the biriyani if you give a to go order it seems( shared by the guy serving).. do check with the restaurant on the chef before coming here.. Got a comment from the owner today after an year of my post which clearly shows that either he is misinformed or is clearly disillusioned..there is seriously something wrong..however my review is based on the quality of biriyani we had an year ago..not sure if that improved..

v00ldudJayTiB402gnQ2Hg.text: Always refreshing to have food with spice and flavor in the Matthews area. Great personable ownership and quality authentic food.

Kfs9GV4vDY_dlfETcFV4fQ.text: Had the Aloo Gobi. It was very good. The coriander really sets it off nicely. The veggies were just a little on the soggy side but I did have about a 15 minute drive home. I am a vegetarian and there was a piece of chicken in the meal despite the fact it is a vegetarian dish. It was easy to see and not eat. Not the biggest deal. I am looking forward to going back but will mention the meat restriction explicitly next time.

sXfKG4yzQYkHOYgC2qOAWg.text: While the food was pretty good. (We prefer Tamarind) the service was soooo slow. It took 25 minute in between each course and non of the food came out together. My husband was done with his meal before I was even served. And I had to ask for rice (it's that a given when u get Indian?) The takeaway orders were given preferences over the dining room patrons.  Whats up with that??? In the end we spent 2 long hours there and won't be back.

XTfVXisPl0ttDI7qwArniA.text: We were at the movies and noticed this restaurant. We decided to try it as we are always on the lookout for good Indian cuisine near Matthews. It was delicious!!! We had the cauliflower appetizer, chicken tikka masala and malai kabob. Everything came out fresh and hot. And the flavors of each dish were outstanding!! The service was good. Our waitress was very sweet and the owner was very nice. Also a very reasonable price point. Will definitely go again.

2gEQi4mJACAfiK_QVVFmSQ.text: I wish I could leave a review less than 1 star! I was so excited to try this place. It was a terrible experience. Even the chai tea was awful. We waited for over an hour and a half, and when we finally got the food the beef Nihari tasted like a dirty sock that had been soaking in water. We finally just left, and got Chinese food next door.

Xp8dsMPdrzxyWU-pYr9MBA.text: Great hidden gem by the movie theatre. On a whim went there and found some of the best Indian cuisine in Charlotte in quite awhile. The current owners have only been there 3 months but they are off to a a great start. This looks like a small family run business. Everyone was super friendly. The naan was made right;  thin and crispy and not like pita. The entrees are generous and well executed. Looking forward to many more trips there.

yRSTEARl1WEyHXr_CO5grw.text: Yay, great North Indian food on my side of town! We split the Paneer Tikka and Paneer Balti, the naan and rice were perfection -- great food. Service is super low key, so dont come expecting a jovial reception. Ill definitely be a regular customer, with such close proximity to my home.

PeLDtsUcZglO-bk3NLkRcw.text: The staff was pleasant and the food was great.   The lamb biryani was spiced just right, tasted delicious and we had enough to take home for later.  We also had samosas, malai kofta, garlic naan, a mango lassi and a masala chai.  Give this small place a try, you'll be glad you did.

Xf7plp2T64KqsMGmZY6BTA.text: A right place for yummy and delicious food with a great and humble staff. Good thing is they are very polite and supportive irrespective of the time you call for food. I strooooooooongly suggest to all the food lovers.  Bharat is the one who could feast you till your tummy full with reasonable prices. Thanks for everything guys!!!!

Mkfbf32t7E-2_2_tUWSEjg.text: Glad to find this restaurant that serves good Indian food in a small but comfortable and clean environment. Pleasant staff seems to attract "regulars".

QFvojy27NTJN4KrasZaVrw.text: Oddest experience I've ever had at a restaurant.  Greeted by, food order taken and bill given by 2 kids, both probably under the age of 13.  Presented themselves well but still really weird.  Seems to be family run but the food is not authentic.  Paneer kathi roll tasted like a sad imitation of a Big Mac with raw paneer and raw onions, with 1 lonely green pepper and tomato piece added in.  Vegetable Biryani was still wet and much spicier than requested.  Update following the business' comment: I still stand by my review.  Apologies that I miscalculated the girls age; but the boy who greeted us and took our order was still young.  I've never heard of a Kathi roll being a "cold sub".  If you are trying your hand at fusion food then you might want to consider actually describing it.  I hadn't realized that a spice level 5 out of 10 was considered spicy, I thought that meant medium.  Good to note!!!    As for letting my server know - if I thought I would have liked the taste after the changes then I would have bothered with the effort.  Previously I hadn't bothered mentioning that the raita that was served was so sour that I actually believe it had gone rancid.    We came here on the recommendation of a friend.  They liked the food (take out), we did not.  My feelings and feedback on the restaurant have nothing to do with my outlook on life. I wish you the best and much success.

FEbW1aHucWwnblSKIhAW9A.text: Just went here for the first time and everything was excellent.  The food was delicious and the service was top notch.  The food had a broad range of spice level from 1-10.  My wife got the Chicken Tikka Masala at a 2, and I got the Chcken Biryani at a 5.  Mine at a 5 was at a spice level on par with most other Indian places.  Next time we will both get it a bit spicier, but it is nice to see a mild option for a change.  We will definitely be coming back as regulars.

AwjnJh2c3-Fz29GQ4vesnQ.text: This has been our go to place for Indian Food. Love it. The cauliflower, the tikka masala are very good.

zDNI4kQktwigN_OByIMNXQ.text: The atmosphere has much to be desired, beer & wine not served.  But the service in this little family restaurant is charming.  The food is excellent. Can't wait to come back to try more!

is8sPmwhI6YgSE2j3vEySA.text: I have now had the pleasure of visiting Royal Biryani four times, and have had consistently excellent experiences each time. All the dishes I have tried have been delicious, full of rich flavors, and made with clearly high-quality ingredients. The menu isn't huge, but there is certainly plenty of variety to suit different preferences. The dining room is small, but I myself have gotten take-away here, and noticed that many people seem to do so, leaving ample room for dine-in customers. I love Indian food, and have dined at many Indian restaurants, and I can honestly say that Royal Boryani is among the best I have tried. My elderly parents also have loved it both times they have had it. It's definitely a favorite with our family!

Ckdcr9Usxz6A0WxpAiB8Jw.text: Am reviewing again after  1 year. We have been regularly having take out from here in the evenings. Recently I happened to visit during lunch time during weekday for a sit in. They have great lunch platter choices that are fresh made - starting with a veg soup (yellow dal). The included naan (bread) was the best I had.  The quantity and quality was really value for money.  The heavy steel cutlery also gives a good feel.

lla6-4MxQNnJUuU_ZoVezg.text: Came based on word of mouth from friends and presently surprised. Traditionally have not been a fan of Indian food but it's been growing on me with the opening of Tandur. With that being said, this was better and significantly more satisfying. I would suggest the Samosa Chat as an appetizer (like regular samosas but waaaay better). I tried the Shahi Korma and it was amazing! Creamy but also with warming spices. Haven't figured out quite my right spice level (1-10) but will be coming back to find out!

pDtpnZh7CnO8THjB6ljzjg.text: The best Indian food in Charlotte. Such a nice vibe this restaurant has. Great friendly service, clean cozy interiors. The food is phenomenal. They obviously know what they are doing. Best samosa ever. Crispy, right out of the oil and the correct size. Not Those small ones you find in some other places. They have the ajwain seeds on the wrapper that make it taste like it's out of a sweet stall in India. Amazing! The bread is without a doubt best bread in Charlotte. Garlic naan and aloo paratha with that butter. Tasted like some bread I ate in Chandigarh a year ago. Kadai paneer made the right way as well. And to top it all the service was impeccable. They even gave me an extra mango lassi to go. The mango lassi was amazing as well. Can't wait for my next trip for more.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States

vMoN7dC-Bm-v9bACGRtbDA.text: We popped into this little place near Crown Point Bistro theater thinking it would be mediocre at best.  Wow, were we ever surprised!  We shared the outstanding lamb biryani and bhindaloo goat (a few bones but lots of flavor) but the real surprise was the kashmiri naan.  Soft and warm naan with coconut and honey in the middle.  This is Northern Indian at its best, and you can get it spicy to taste on a scale from 1 -10.  The staff was kind and helpful, led by a delightful young host/waiter/son of the owner, who was most enthusiastic.  They've only been open for 4 months but we are definitely going back.  Their secret is that they do not skimp on spices (curry, saffron, etc.) - not just heat, but the flavorful spices that make the difference between standard buffet fare and truly good Indian food.  One of the best Indian restaurants we have found!

R5HEINevsgi4s0HrX9nN5A.text: Atrocious quality of food. When this place opened it looked like a place that would serve authentic Hyderabadi dishes at a reasonable price. The quality of the food steadily came down to a point where their food tastes very stale and has ZERO flavor. Looks like the owners of this place threw in the towel and are pretty much out to get whatever they can before they eventually shut down this place.   The attitude of the people that work at this place isn't very helpful either when it comes to addressing customer complaints about the quality of the food that's served. Won't be going back to this place EVER.

SwCD4dCFSjK3uY2tCD2grA.text: Just wanted to thank the staff at Royal Biryani for a wonderful dining experience. The front of house staff were very friendly, helpful, and attentive. The food was nothing short of miraculous!! This was our first experience eating Indian food and we certainly hope its not our last.

pN3CP7xEOgjGQ69YIh0GKQ.text: Really great, fresh Indian food. They do not play with the spice level. I like spicy food but the level 7 spice got me sweating.

J6YxfuKPbEe_v91FWJ36eA.text: YUM oh my gosh so happy this place is here.  I ordered Shahi Minced Paneer (heat level 5) and garlic chili Naan.  My dish did not look like the picture, but it was absolutely delicious.   The Naan was literally dripping with garlic and chili.  I also got the samosas, which were really good and came with 2 dipping sauces.  I had plenty of food for dinner and then lunch the next day. The menu is pretty extensive and I can't wait to go back.  Might be dangerous having such deliciousness so close by!   As others have said, the restaurant itself is not fancy, but the food oh yes.

STNGola0e09h0WFJ0ak90A.text: Great Indian food at a reasonable price. Who can beat that?  Went there for the first time today at lunch and was very impressed by the friendly staff, nice restaurant and amazing food. Check it out if you get the chance.

I93P6lE6LExXK5PJnAjpgA.text: First time going to this Indian restaurant and when I first walked in the door it smelled amazing. The customer service was ok, when I asked what a kind of food tasted like that I'd never had before they told me they can't describe it and it's good. I decided to give it a try and it was pretty good. My wife's Korma was better, but overall it was a good experience outside of my question not being answered. If I'm in the area I will be back

DsIEcYl2aRdta0DLHaJCKA.text: Ordered again from Royal Biryani  through door dash and food was much tastier than it was for my last review. Quality was better as were the flavors. I understand there are new owners and the change is much welcomed.

UQHZHLPhp7cHczS7zFNV6A.text: This is a little gem on monroe road near cinemark cinema. The most excellent dishes. Owner came by and spoke and was very nice. Nice interior and delicious food.

lpIC1DBvjoJf8MwFaomJZA.text: We love the food here. The price is great for Indian food. The place is clean, service was friendly. Chicken Tikka Masala was so awesome. Definitely will be back.

vZgJNEkY8iBl5eGPeGGSww.text: Why 5 Stars? Excellent Nann bread tasted like it was baked in a very old Tandoor.  Chicken Tikka Masala very nicely done with good quality chicken.  The Chicken Biryani was excellent and aromatic.  The place felt clean and felt Indian with the beautiful hand made mirror frames on wall. Advice/add little Indian music contemporary new age style and raise volume a bit so customers won't hear staff in kitchen. Samosa was lovely too and I will return.

WcqwsZ8DL-Nt-RzQXfv5DA.text: There is nothing royal about this restaurant. Ordered chicken tikka kabob grill and threw most of it in the garbage.

vZNXwSB48Jbruy-GorNoCg.text: Awful customer service. They have a little kid working the front who is so rude. I asked how much longer the food is going to be he told me 2 to 5 minutes. I come back five minutes later still the food isn't ready. I again asked him how much longer for the food he just shrugged his shoulders. I placed the order at 1:35pm. I was told 20-25 min. I got there at 2:10 and food wasn't ready. I'm not an impatient person, but I had my two kids in the car. I asked him to please check the kitchen he got irritated and flustered and even tripped over his wiring because didn't want to get up.   I was told for a tandoori chicken order it came with four legs and two breast. I got two drumsticks and two breast it's literally 2 tablespoons of rice. I then checked the seekh kebab and it look like someone did not know how to make it. It's not actual kebab. It looks like falafel. I don't even know what to call it. I will post pictures. I was charged $50 for those two dishes and a chicken tikka masala. They definitely over charge here for mediocre food. The tandoori chicken and the seekh kabob were both dry. The chicken tikka Masala was 7/10 but hardly any chicken in there. The only positive about this place is when you ask for mild in spice, they provide it.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States

Xxe8ZoCH3jSjND-hyTvzZw.text: I had nice complete lunch specials including desert nan chicken masala for 9 and eggplant and potatoes for 8.  I would suggest it to anyone tasty and filling.  Well served. I would eat every week.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch special complete meals for 8 -10.

HJbNB72wG9nwoMCEPpK2qw.text: This has quickly become my favorite restaurant in Charlotte. BY FAR the best Indian food I've had since I went to India. Very authentic. I've been about five times in the past month in a half. Each time I've tried something different and everything has been delicious. Their lunch specials are fantastic. Dinner menu is of course a little more expensive but you get a bigger selection. So far the Kadai curry and biryani are my favorites. If you like Indian food, go here! You'll be so glad you did.

Llqg2E7uGxRxnqBGy31ieQ.text: This is my favorite Indian spot in Charlotte, everything is delicious. The naan was so well made (slightly crispy at the bottom for amazing texture & crunch), the tikka masala I had order at 10 spice was perfect for my heat seeking palette. Service & staff were incredibly friendly & welcoming. & after talking to the manager I had learned the chef is from Nepal, so thumbs up for authenticity!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tikka Masala for lunch! Everything was fantastic, &amp; it also came with soup. The service &amp; staff are also so friendly/inviting!

R1VMIEyuGLDCydntrClpgw.text: Stopped into the the recently renovated Royal Biryani restaurant this evening. Mercy goodness finally a legit, great Indian restaurant in the area.   Sadly I was the only one there so not sure how many people know about the place but without a doubt I'll be back. Had a traditional curry with chicken (if ya can't do a traditional curry right then what's the point being open) and it was spot on.   Located corner of Sardis North & Monroe (in the shops by the movie theater). Just thought I'd share. Would like to see this place stick around. The owner is a gem.   Just my two cents.

-O_d0GCsOD-KXf5evKD5lA.text: Just wow. Really amazing place for authetic Indian food. The atmosphere is okay but the food more than makes up for it. Just WOW.  Pros: simple menu, clean atmosphere, delicious food, good prices,  Cons: location mostly. Otherwise amazing

VpTGS3q33d3am1wmmxNisA.text: Great Indian food. Friendly staff. We ordered Tikka Chicken Masala. You can choose between 10 different spice level from mild to very hot. We will definitely come back!

0MYcl5X4C8VuZ6azmaf77w.text: The best Indian bar none! The chef is amazing. He came over from the now closed Tamarind.  The favors are authentic and exceptional.   This is a special meal served by a caring man in a small homey place.  The pace of service is slow and relaxed. We come here all the time.  It's like eating with family.

Kfeab9sWw5Btt3chD-arTw.text: I have been here twice with my girlfriend. The food has been fantastic both times. They give large portions and the food gets to the table quickly. The waiter/owner is very polite and he is very helpful with the menu. Ask questions if you don't know what is what. The garlic nan is the best!!

RJOVzhEGfiWAXyEt4_TcjA.text: We really like Indian food, but haven't found a go to place for us. We came here honestly because we went to a movie next door. My wife loves biryani, and wanted to try it. The food came out perfect and hot, with generous portions. We really have another meal at home from or two entrees. As well the black dal was good, and the rasmalai was great as well. The owner is very friendly and he is the cook as well.

HgV_MyxfBi5Xan8fnXCY7g.text: update: new owners, new menu, completely different cuisine in fact only the name remains royalbiryanius.com We badly need culinary variety in this neighborhood and I hope they figure things out soon. Hint: don't expect the dishes to be as described or depicted in the pictures.

-v5n9nzaNbmO2zJothEQtg.text: One of the best biryanis I have ever had in charlotte. Tandoori chicken is very good and rich in flavor. I will come back for sure.

55gta5tD8Uy-GqCuLMrY4w.text: This place is a diamond in the rough. Roger is a great sever! The food took no time at all to come out, great flavors, perfect spice, and just all around a fantastic meal.  I can't wait to come back and bummed it took so long for me to find it!!

zDl5lwEY_3pDqqGhs6TEvw.text: Royal Biryani and Kabob is delicious and don't be afraid to order a lot because it makes for superb leftovers. However, they are painfully slooooooow. We spent about 2.5 hrs. in the restaurant and we've got two kids under the age of three, so, that sort of time frame doesn't work well for us. The food is incredibly fresh, authentic, and clearly made from scratch. I would be thrilled to eat Royal's food again (and again), however, I'm putting them in the take-out category from now on. Order your food about an hour before you intend to pick it up.   Of note, the interior is very clean and staff are friendly and clearly care about the quality of the food. It has the feel of a family-run restaurant, in a good way.

M8jYptcO48iPA4v42aP0fA.text: This is the best Indian food I've had outside of Toronto or New York City. Can't wait to try more dishes!

XT0VjNHu0MkxK2zld4ALuw.text: The food is good. The prices are high. The wait is long. I appreciate that the food is made to order, but when I order to go, this place consistently takes 15-20 min longer than they say it will take. If they say it will be ready in 30 min, it will be 45 min. This is problematic when picking up food from other places and trying to coordinate so all the food is finished and hot at the same time. It's not a deal breaker, but I'd switch to another Indian restaurant if there was another that was closer.

dXx_wqA9w0Gj7-67QsR0GQ.text: Absolutely blown away with how delicious this place was....  I had a bad experience with Indian food living in the Chicagoland region and have shied away from it since.  But my date opted for me to try the tandoor chicken, curry goat, all 3 desserts and the goat biryani.  Veg options as well are a plus   Authentic spices and flavors, very homey and excellent service   We ate a garlic bread(naan), an appetizer (chicken tandoor) - super juicy and 3 dishes on top of 3 desserts.    Must try

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dish after dish can&#39;t stop so good

f7NOsvvqbST0p89BylkYiQ.text: Authentic Indian food is back in Matthews and it is fabulous!  Roger was my server and was very attentive. The flavors are deep and rich with nothing held back. I had the Chicken Tika Masala with soup, naan, and a special dessert. The naan was perfectly soft and luxurious, the soup was herby and full of flavor, and the chicken was tender and juicy. I am so happy we have a new place to go and fill ourselves with this wonderfully heart-warming food. There's no doubt that this food has been prepared with love and care. I plan to go every week for lunch which was reasonably priced for such amazing food.    Update: April 3, 2019 - The food here is amazing, as always. The community needs to come out and support this amazing chef's dream so I can keep eating it!  This has been a weekly haunt for me since I found it 7 months ago and it is just as good as day one. I am so happy that this place exists.

ms9xszeM4wmztFrwwBzhSQ.text: I've returned tonight after a year to try the food again since a new owner has taken over.  The menu had a lot of options and familiar ones with different titles.  Like the restaurant before, the menu doesn't say if rice comes with the curry.  I wanted to be sure to ask for rice.  It did come with the meal because the total didn't change.  I ordered the vegetable Shahi korma that has a nice amount of veggies.  Usually I'd order chicken and ask for some veggies to come with it.  The spice level ranged from 1-10.  I picked 5 for a halfway point which was sensible.  I could do a 6 next time.  The garlic naan met my expectations.  The food was much more appealing to the eye.  I will return for more.  I'll probably get the Kadai, carrot halwa, or the supreme rasmalai next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shahi Korma with garlic naan
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Butter chicken and butter naan to go Good portion of chicken
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Butter chicken and plain naan

txQX_JNcFngAVqzmKRZT0A.text: First time at this site. Nice clean restaurant in a strip mall. Small menu but goodies on it. Started with the Gobi in a spicy sauce, just delicious fried cauliflower! Very Good ! Next had a Chat that was described as being like Nachos, had a strange little cracker with Chick peas and Tamarind and cilantro Chutney. Ordered three types of Bread. A Chili Garlic Naan, a Butter Roti, and a Butter Naan. We were getting full so we only had the Black Buttery Dahl. Which was a lite brown but needed more seasoning. The Chili Garlic Naan was so delicious ! The wait in between courses was way too long. Cannot figure out why, it wasn't busy and the Dahl would have already been cooked. Friendly waitress. Just needs some fine tuning .

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy Gobi
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chat
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chili Garlic Naan

oU3c_ucAShfcus24r7LWAw.text: I recently found this place on a whim and am so delighted! The food is flavorful, authentic and the portions generous.  The people who run the restaurant are so pleasant and kind, too.  Friendly, knowledgeable to the menu.  And if Indian food isn't your foray they'll help guide you to a dish you're sure to love.  I've already been back 3 times in 2 weeks and have recommended to friends in the area.  You must try! Perfect for dinner and a movie with the theatre right next door too!

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Tikka masala (take out)

tTpk2Y7N334ljkhUAdEgjg.text: Fabulous fine Indian cuisine at it's best!  Feeling so blessed to have this wonderful restaurant so close by ...just off Sardis Road.  We've been trying different dishes since learning about Royal Biryani several months ago by many recommendations on the Nextdoor app. Some of our favorites include chicken Tikki Masala, chicken Bhindaloo, and tandoori chicken kabobs!  Many vegetarian dishes as well. The dishes are served with a soup and the best naan I've ever eaten.  We love that we can choose our heat level for each dish!  Delicious food, cozy environment and great customer service for fine Indian cuisine has made Royal Biryani a weekly lunch/dinner outing for our family! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Another fabulous meal at Royal Biryani!
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rice &amp; naan
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken tikki masala &amp; Chicken Bhindaloo

cN4nn37EN_bAudictkhO5A.text: We're lucky to have such great Indian food nearby. Everything we've had has been tasty.  Meat lovers and vegetarians alike will find something good to eat. You can also tell them, on a scale of 1-10 how hot/spicy you would like your dish. Samosa Chat is an excellent appetizer.  The vegetable biryani comes with two great sauces and is huge; enough for 2 meals or leftovers. The garlic naan is crispy and delish. If you like Indian food, this can be your go-to place, especially since the prices are reasonable.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable biryani
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mango and chickpeas with crackers.

qgFT0V7vSRSWOhnIJfflWg.text: Royal Biryani offers a good lunch menu and excellent service. I had the cauliflower curry with potato and really enjoyed it. The lunch special comes with soup or salad, naan bread, rice, and the dessert of the day. They ask you about spice level when you order and also after you've had a chance to try your food which I've never encountered before but really appreciated. I would definitely suggest giving this place a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cauliflower curry with potato, naan bread, and dessert (wheat noodle, milk, and sugar).

K5Y05XY6rGCUVfybFFmr4g.text: Amazing! I've been to several Indian places in Charlotte and this is by far the best! I highly recommend trying the biryani. As the name suggests it's their specialty. I especially love the naan and roti and they all come with amazing sauces. Can't say enough about this place been here twice so fat and it will definitely be a regular spot for us.

3Y0jRT3gl-HZ4akBnaQUCA.text: After ordering takeout a few times, I finally tried Royal Biryani in person. There were some hits and misses but overall I enjoyed the experience.   This is not a fancy place, but the homey family atmosphere created by the manager (? owner?) and her playful children running around made our night happy. Our 3 yr old started playing with her 3 yr old. The people at the table behind me turned around and started talking to us. The table on the other side of us joined in and before long the entire restaurant was having dinner and conversation together.   The service was good and the food was hot and fresh. I ordered two plates of the JADUEE GOBI because the first plate was so good. I asked for the first extra crispy and it was. And it was delicious. The second wasn't quite as good since I didn't specify that but still nice flavor. Good onion cilantro tomato sauce mixture. A little spice (I chose level 5 of 10), a little tart, a little sweet. Pretty well rounded.   The FISH CURRY was very fishy tasing, which is common to every Indian restaurant I've ever eaten fish curry at. Overall the flavor was good and the rice was right    The ONION KULCHA was clearly homemade, which is nice. However everything about it was a fail for me. The onions inside were still very firm and raw. The dough was uncooked and thick. And the only edible pieces were around the edges. This could've benefited from a bit more time in the tandoor.   I will come back for the Gobi though.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Jaduee Gobi

ZFNkikKLw9fXoL7MN5jRlQ.text: Fabulous food at Royal Biryani yesterday before going to a movie at Cinemark!   Ordered a 4 spice, which was perfect for me - MIGHT go a 5 if I'm feeling it!  Owners and chef introduced themselves, and were kind and excellent and super attentive.   My crew of 4 were very pleased with the food and the authentic selection.  I think this might be part of our regular guys night!

ofVg1_dZMiDH7n7yWXFanw.text: Not my favorite Indian Cuisine. I live right around the corner from this new spot, so I thought I'd give it a try. The samosa's are huge so they give you 2 verses the smaller ones, I prefer. I did manage to eat most of them because those were decent, but really oily. I didn't care for anything else. I've labeled my pictures so feel free to read away.   The Paneer Kathi roll was huge, but it was cold like an egg salad wrap. It was also a little sweet so I didn't enjoy that at all.   The Tikhe Paneer taste similar to chili chicken without the meat and spices. It was a little spicy, but it taste like hot sauce and oil. No herbs at all. I didn't like this dish either.   The Vegetable Biryani was okay.   Samosa's were decent just very oily and thick. I prefer the appetizer size.   Garlic naan was good, but anybody can make that happen, lol.   Overall, I would not give this place another go. I don't eat meat, so I couldn't try the popular tikka masala. Maybe their curry dishes are better, who knows?  All I know is this place doesn't  compare to Jaipur Indian Cuisine on South Blvd. or Hyderabadi Biryani House off Lancaster Hwy.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paneer Kathi Roll
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegetable Biryani
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Samosa

8CplzHxqx_J9sNazF1Ze-Q.text: Update ---  They've added some serving staff so ... 5 stars!  ---  The food is really good and so are the We've been multiple times and tried several dishes - chicken tikka masala, chicken/veg bhindaloo, Shahi korma, shahi minced paneer, malai kofta, Garlic naan and aaloo dhaniya paratha. All were really good, but I guess my least favorite was the bhindaloo. It could have used a little more flavor and heat. I would still try it again at a higher spice #. Shahi korma was my favorite (even though I nearly burnt myself up with an 8).If you're afraid of heat, no worries. My husband likes dishes on the milder side and his dishes (3s & 4s) come out to his liking.   The only cons on this place are the location (strip mall-ish) and the service. Location is what it is and we don't mind. Service is my reason for 4 stars and not 5. There's sometimes just one person taking orders, serving, preparing deliveries, answering the phone, and working the register. That can result in some slow downs. They are in the process of hiring more servers, kitchen staff, etc. so I think the service will absolutely pick up.   Overall, the food is fantastic + service issues will be corrected soon with additional staff. Will add a star when that happens. I am looking forward to eating at this place regularly.

6_N-rAc_5hovjlkhVGcFhA.text: I knew I wanted samosas and decided to try a place up the street from home. I also wanted to get my mother (who doesn't always enjoy other cuisines) to try something new. We both loved them! They were huge, full of flavor, and succeeded at satisfying my craving. My mom also enjoyed them. They came with 2 different sauces, one green, one like a dark brown. The green sauce brought out the flavors in the food more. The brown sauce was sweet but also enjoyable. I would definitely recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States

D2m3QWsNvQLgSd-yHhtaUA.text: I brought two friends back for another crack at this one. They both have just as much experience with Indian food as I.  We ordered the Aloo Gobi, Tandoori Chicken and Chicken Biryani, plus two orders of Garlic Naan. The staff was on their A game tonight. Even the chef came out and did table checks. We ordered everything with a spice level of five and we liked the fact that the Tandoori came with sliced chili's so we could go up a notch or two if we wanted. Next time we will try the spice level of 7 and see where that leads. Alicia liked that the Tandoori Chicken was juicy. I liked that the chicken in the Biryani was tender. Karl liked everything. It's a great little restaurant for a date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Naan
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Biryani
Photo of Royal Biryani - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tandoori Chicken

M2WDfI9XV4mL8dVue2EAvA.text: Quality Indian food. Went here for a late lunch on a Sunday. Wasn't crowded. Had Samosa Chat, Roti, Chicken Tikka Masala and Aloo Ghobi. Everything was delicious and the service was friendly. We'll be back!

Kh-_v-y2SdcycGF39ASE1Q.text: I come here often with my fiance because they have a very good affordable vegan Indian food menu. Roger is always pleasant and provides great service. Highly recommended!

HJevd9BR6a4GSLATzFMAbQ.text: THAT NAAN THO. Really was surprised by this place, is very small and not much to look at, but the Indian food is the best that I've had in Charlotte (way cheaper than Copper too). One Tikka masala and one naan are enough to feed two, easily.

5Ne9DTTfgkaDIcwIMswh4g.text: Had the vegetable biryani and my husband had chicken butter masala. It was all very delicious! Great service, great food! Can't wait to come again! Love supporting small, local businesses. Roger was our server and he was very friendly.

pwfpNYuXwFZ2GNNZgCS6Mg.text: Why is this owner responding that negative reviews are BS?  I don't think they understand how local business works?

AsH4kjv4G3sJMFoCFIWk2g.text: This was a great place. Naan was some of the best, I think because it is freshly made, as with all there food! Couldn't ask for better customer service from owner and staff taking the time to explain the menu and Indian food! Great experience!

uDthIKh-YvIagVoLJWIJqg.text: Food and customer service is excellent at this restaurant. Finally we have an authentic Indian/Pakistani restaurant.  The food is mouth watering delicious. Food is freshly made when you order.  The kabobs are succulent and if you try the roll wrapped in paratha it is just yummy. I ordered 3 items to go. Food was fresh and made to order. I would definitely recommend this restaurant.
